item.description:
Visceral Murmurs: An Afternoon with Photographer Scott Erb Sat, 09/15/2012 - 1:00pm

Spend some time at Fruitlands Museum's Art Gallery with photographer Scott Erb as he walks you through the creative process behind the photographs in this show. Scott will give an artist talk, followed by a very informal question-and-answer session. This will be and interactive experience and Scott will openly answer questions, discuss creativity, and where to find inspiration.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Scott Erb is a nationally published and collected artist from the central New England area. His work has been exhibited at the Center for Creative Photography in Fort Collins, Colorado, and the Spectrum Gallery in Rochester, NY, as well as many local shows since 1997. His work has received numerous awards and honors including Best Photo Studio for 3 years in a row and a Massachusetts Cultural Council Grant to publish a show and book entitled 20 Artists of Worcester. Specializing in figurative imagery, He utilizes classical lighting techniques and modern premise. He studied photography in Daytona Beach Florida at the Center for Photo/Graphic Studies where he developed his first figurative portfolio. He continues to create fine art figurative images while at the same time engages in a flourishing commercial photography career. Scott founded the Worcester Alliance of Photographers in 2003 and loves sharing the art of creating with photography with members.


Free with Admission to the Museum

PURCHASE MUSEUM & GROUNDS ADMISSION AT THE MUSEUM STORE

Fruitlands Museum Members FREE
Adults $12.00
Seniors (60+) and Students w/a valid student id $10.00

Please note that the Fruitlands is a beautiful location. You may want to come early or stay a bit later then the talk and visit the museum and the grounds. Make a day of it!

 

Hope to see you there.

 

Cheers,

Scott and Donna
item.how_to_find_us: We will be in the Art Gallery

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Come hear Scott Erb's Artist Talk at the Fruitlands Museum This Saturday at 1PM
